result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Lamar Harris

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Jakaiah C. forwarded to Supervisor on 11/4/22 for approval on Invoice #AT000121 WF in court 2x on 10/24/22, 10/25/22.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Susan K. forwarded to Supervisor on 11/4/22 for approval on Invoice #AT000120 WF in court 1x on 10/25/22.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Benjamin C. forwarded to Supervisor on 11/4/22 for approval on Invoice #AT000119 WF in court 1x on 10/25/22.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Expires 1/25/23

Defendant Steven Lamar Harris in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Spilfeigel for Allison Marie Ritter in court for Steven Lamar Harris.  Attorney Julie Knyszek for Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Jurors present.  Deliberations continued.  Juror submit question.  While parties are arriving, another question comes from the jurors.  Court numbers questions.  Question 3 & 4 asked this date.  Based on the most recent question submitted by the jurors (marked as #4), Court declares a mistrial.  Jury in the box at the hour of 11:36 am.  Court advises the jurors based on the last question/statement received by the Court and the violation of the juror oath, Court has not choice but to declare a mistrial.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 11:48 am.  

Court advised Defendant all conditions of bail remain the same.  Exhibits withdrawn.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Lamar Harris in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter and Nathan Szpilfeiget in court for Steven Lamar Harris.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen and Julie Knyszek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Trial continued.  Court addresses motion to unseal Victim's medical records.  Court denies motion.  Parties stipulate to Exhibit #13 - Crime Lab Report.  Jury in the box at the hour of 9:15 am.  Sworn for the State:  Oak Creek Police Department Officer Benjamin Lockwood.  Direct examination.  Exhibit #'s 4, 17, 16, 19, 18 & 20 marked offered and received.  Cross examination.  Defe4nse Exhibit #30 marked, offered and received.  Re-direct.  Sworn for the State:  Oak Creek Police Department Detective Gary Schneider.  Direct examination.  Exhibit #'s 14, 11, 7, 21, 15 & 1 marked, offered and received.  Court takes short break.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 10:43 am.  Jury in the box at the hour of 11:13 am.  Direct examination continued.  Exhibit #13 marked, offered, received and read into the record.  Cross examination.  Re-Direct.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 12:03 pm.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of State's case denied by the court.  Court breaks for lunch.  

PM SESSION.  SAME APPEARANCES.  
Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify.
Sworn for Defense: Jakaiah C.  Direct examination.  Cross.  
Defense rests.  
State and Defense rest.  Testimony closed.  
Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by State and Defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:51 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Matthew Seifert and Jeff Hartung who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 2:51.  Court in recess.  Jury questions addressed by the parties.  No objection by either party to viewing of requested exhibits.

Case recalled at the hour of 4:40 pm.  Jury in the box at the hour of 4:40 pm.  Jury has not reached verdicts.  Court excuses Jury for the day.  Jury to return by 8:30 am on October 27, 2022.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 4:43 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

PM SESSION.

Trial continued.  Jury in the box at the hour of 1:40 pm.  Direct examination of Jakaiah C. continued.  Exhibit #'s 2 & 11 marked offered and received.  Cross.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 2:33 pm.  In chambers discussion placed on the record.  Jury in the box at the hour of 2:38 pm.  Re-Direct.  Re-Cross.  Sworn for the State:  Froedtert and Medical College of Wisconsin Forensic Nurse Susan Kanack.  Exhibit #12 marked, offered and received.  Direct examination.  No Cross.  Court breaks for the date.  Jury to return by 8:30 am on October 26, 2022.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 3:22 pm.

Parties discuss impeachment of the victim.  Court to rule on Lawful Order to release medical records pursuant to Wis. Stats. Section 146.82(2)(a)(4).  Case adjourned for Jury Trial October 26, 2022 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Steven Lamar Harris in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter and Nathan Szpilfeigel in court for Steven Lamar Harris.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen and Julie Knyszek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
AM SESSION.  
Jury in the box at the hour of 8:51 am.  Jury Sworn.  Sworn for the State:  Benjamin C.  Direct examination.  Exhibit #8 marked, offered and received.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 9:39 am.  Court addresses objections.  Jury in the box at the hour of 9:45 am.  Direct examination continued.  Cross examination.  Re-direct.  Sworn for the State:  Oak Creek Police Department Detective jason Baranek.  Direct examination.  cross.  Court takes short break.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 10:07 am.  Jury in the box at the hour of 10:32 am.  Sworn for the State:  Jakaiah C.  Direct examination.  Exhibit #'s 5, 10, 3, 6, and 9 marked, offered and received.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 11:35 am.  Jury in the box at the hour of 11:46 am.  Direct examination continued.  Court breaks for lunch.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 12:00 pm.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:43 am.  Court breaks for lunch.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 12:05 pm.  Juror #25 did not return after lunch.  Juror 25 struck for cause.  Jury in the box at the hour of 1:42 pm.  Voir dire continued.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 3:06 pm.  Jury in the box at the hour of 3:16 pm.    
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled.  Jury list received and filed.  Court takes short break.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 3:28 pm.  Jury in the box at the hour of 3:57 pm.  Court breaks for the day and instructs the jury to return between 8:15 am and 8:30 am on October 25, 2022.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 4:01 pm.  Jury instructions addressed outside the presence of the jury.  Case adjourned to October 25, 2022 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Steven Lamar Harris in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter and Nathan Szpilfeigel in court for Steven Lamar Harris.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen and Julie Knyszek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 

Jury call proceeded.  State and Defense prepared to proceed to trial.  Case passed.
State's Witness List received and filed.  bm
Motions in Limine received and filed.  bm

Defendant Steven Harris in court.  Defendant Steven Harris in custody.  Attorney Allison Ritter in court for the Defendant.  Erin Karshen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Final Pretrial held.  State and Defense prepared to proceed to trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial October 24, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Motion in Limine received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Proposed Witness List received and filed.  bm
Filed: Original Transcript of Arraignment/Bail Bond Hearing (22 pages) commencing 08-02-2022 by Carole Serota-Bondi.
Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges signed and filed.  bm
Speedy trial demand.  Expires 10/31/22

Defendant Steven Lamar Harris in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Steven Lamar Harris in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Defense requests a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial.  Court reiterated conditions of bail and advised Defendant is to remain in custody until a GPS monitor is available if cash bail has been paid.  Court addressed State' Motion to Rescind Defendant's privileges.  Additional statements by:  Jakaiah C.  Court GRANTS State's motion to rescind Defendant's privileges with the exception of Attorney Ritter and her investigator.  State to draft an order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp. 10/17

Defendant Steven Lamar Harris in court with Attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Steven Lamar Harris in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 20CF1476. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective G. Schneider. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Arraignment scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Rescind received and filed.  bm
Order Appointing Private Investigator signed and filed.  bm
Defendant's Motion for Expert Funding received and filed.  bm
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  bm

Defendant Steven Lamar Harris in court, in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case in court for State v Lee Hearing.  No attorney has been appointed by the Public Defender's Office.   Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel the court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense.   The court appointed Attorney Allison Ritter to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered that the Defendant does not have to repay Milwaukee County.  Attorney Ritter appears via telephone and accepts appointment.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Lamar Harris not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-LEE Hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's MOTION TO DISMISS FOR DEFECTIVE COMPLAINT.  (Steven L. Harris - #2022005260, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's NOTICE OF MOTION.  (Steven L. Harris - #2022005260, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Steven Lamar Harris not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter/affidavit re:  dismissing this case.

Defendant Steven Lamar Harris not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
 Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JDC and BC

Defendant Steven Lamar Harris in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Steven Lamar Harris in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven Lamar Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.  DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
